\u0628\u0627 \u0646\u06af\u0627\u0647\u064a \u0643\u0644 \u06af\u0631\u0627 \u0628\u0647 \u0631\u0645\u0627\u0646 \u0646\u06af\u0627\u0647 \u0627\u0646\u062f\u0627\u0632\u064a\u0645 \u0628\u0627 \u064a\u0643 \u0631\u0645\u0627\u0646 \u0633\u0648\u0631\u0626\u0627\u0644 \u0637\u0631\u0641 \u0647\u0633\u062a\u064a\u0645. \u062f\u064a\u062f\u06af\u0627\u0647 \u0641\u0645\u064a\u0646\u064a\u0633\u062a\u064a \u062f\u0631 \u062c\u0627\u064a \u062c\u0627\u064a \u0645\u0643\u0627\u0644\u0645\u0647 \u0647\u0627\u064a \u0622\u0627\u0645\u0627\u0645\u0647 \u0648 \u0628\u064a\u0648\u0647 \u0632\u0646 \u0645\u0634\u0647\u0648\u062f \u0627\u0633\u062a. \u0645\u0627\u0646\u0646\u062f \u0628\u0642\u064a\u0647 \u064a \u0643\u062a\u0627\u0628 \u0647\u0627 \u062f\u0631 \u0627\u064a\u0646 \u0631\u0645\u0627\u0646 \u0647\u0645 \u0643\u0634\u0634 \u0642\u0627\u0628\u0644 \u0645\u0644\u0627\u062d\u0638\u0647 \u0627\u064a \u0628\u0631\u0627\u064a \u062e\u0648\u0627\u0646\u062f\u0646 \u0648\u062c\u0648\u062f \u062f\u0627\u0631\u062f \u0648 \u062e\u0648\u0627\u0646\u0646\u062f\u0647 \u0631\u0627 \u0645\u062c\u0628\u0648\u0631 \u0645\u064a \u0643\u0646\u062f \u0643\u0647 \u067e\u0627\u064a \u0643\u062a\u0627\u0628 \u0628\u0646\u0634\u064a\u0646\u062f \u0648 \u0632\u0648\u062f\u062a\u0631 \u0622\u0646 \u0631\u0627 \u0628\u062e\u0648\u0627\u0646\u062f. \u0645\u062a\u0627\u0633\u0641\u0627\u0646\u0647 \u062a\u0631\u062c\u0645\u0647 \u064a \u0643\u062a\u0627\u0628 \u0686\u0646\u06af\u064a \u0628\u0647 \u062f\u0644 \u0646\u0645\u064a\u0632\u0646\u062f \u0648 \u063a\u0644\u0637 \u0647\u0627\u064a \u062a\u0627\u064a\u067e\u064a \u0648 \u0645\u0634\u0643\u0644\u0627\u062a \u0648\u064a\u0631\u0627\u064a\u0634\u064a \u0628\u0647 \u0648\u0641\u0648\u0631 \u062f\u0631 \u0622\u0646 \u064a\u0627\u0641\u062a \u0645\u064a \u0634\u0648\u062f. ...more \u06cc\u06a9 \u0645\u0642\u062f\u0627\u0631 \u0632\u0648\u062f\u0647 \u06a9\u0647 \u0628\u0639\u062f \u0627\u0632 \u062e\u0648\u0646\u062f\u0646 \u0627\u0648\u0644\u06cc\u0646 \u062c\u0644\u062f \u062f\u0631 \u0645\u0648\u0631\u062f \u06cc\u06a9 \u0645\u062c\u0645\u0648\u0639\u0647 \u0633\u0647 \u062c\u0644\u062f\u06cc \u0627\u0638\u0647\u0627\u0631 \u0646\u0638\u0631 \u06a9\u0631\u062f \u0648\u0644\u06cc \u062a\u0627 \u0627\u06cc\u0646\u062c\u0627\u06cc \u06a9\u0627\u0631 \u0633\u0628\u06a9 \u0646\u0648\u0634\u062a\u0627\u0631\u06cc \u0639\u0627\u0644\u06cc \u0627\u06cc \u062f\u0627\u0634\u062a \u0648 \u06cc\u062c\u0648\u0631\u0627\u06cc\u06cc \u0628\u0639\u062f \u0627\u0632 \"\u06a9\u0627\u0641\u06a9\u0627 \u062f\u0631 \u06a9\u0631\u0627\u0646\u0647\" \u0627\u06cc\u0646 \u062f\u0648\u0645\u06cc\u0646 \u06a9\u062a\u0627\u0628 \u0645\u0648\u0631\u0627\u06a9\u0627\u0645\u06cc \u0628\u0648\u062f \u06a9\u0647 \u062a\u0648\u0646\u0633\u062a\u0645 \u0628\u0627\u0647\u0627\u0634 \u0627\u0631\u062a\u0628\u0627\u0637 \u0628\u0631\u0642\u0631\u0627\u0631 \u06a9\u0646\u0645. \u062e\u0648\u0646\u062f\u0646\u0634 \u0631\u0648 \u062a\u0648\u0635\u06cc\u0647 \u0645\u06cc \u06a9\u0646\u0645 \u0628\u0647 \u0647\u0645\u0647. Ano: 1984 AOMAME significa Ervilha Verde, nome que a atormentou ao longo da sua vida. Tem 30 anos, 1 metro e 68 cent\u00edmetros de altura e n\u00e3o possui uma grama de gordura a mais no seu corpo musculado. O \u00fanico pormenor que destoa a sua perfei\u00e7\u00e3o f\u00edsica s\u00e3o as suas orelhas, que diferem na forma e no tamanho: a orelha esquerda \u00e9 muito maior e um pouco deformada. Contudo, na maior parte do tempo est\u00e1 escondida pelo seu cabelo.Apesar da sua beleza, \u00e9 desprovida de express\u00f5es faciais e, por esta raz\u00e3o, o Ano: 1984 AOMAME significa Ervilha Verde, nome que a atormentou ao longo da sua vida. Tem 30 anos, 1 metro e 68 cent\u00edmetros de altura e n\u00e3o possui uma grama de gordura a mais no seu corpo musculado. O \u00fanico pormenor que destoa a sua perfei\u00e7\u00e3o f\u00edsica s\u00e3o as suas orelhas, que diferem na forma e no tamanho: a orelha esquerda \u00e9 muito maior e um pouco deformada. Contudo, na maior parte do tempo est\u00e1 escondida pelo seu cabelo.Apesar da sua beleza, \u00e9 desprovida de express\u00f5es faciais e, por esta raz\u00e3o, o seu rosto causa uma m\u00e1 impress\u00e3o. A qual ainda \u00e9 agravada pelos seus olhos frios e vigilantes. Tudo isto funciona como uma camuflagem. Aomame integra-se no ambiente que a envolve, de modo a passar despercebida. Este \u00e9 o seu m\u00e9todo de defesa. Detentora de uma mem\u00f3ria fora do normal, devora um enorme n\u00famero de livros: romances e, principalmente livros de n\u00e3o fic\u00e7\u00e3o hist\u00f3ricos. Quer queira, que n\u00e3o, todos os factos ficam gravados na sua mente, desde as datas at\u00e9 aos locais onde tiveram lugar os acontecimentos.Por este motivo, Aomame sente que algo muito estranho est\u00e1 acontecer quando, de um momento para o outro, parece n\u00e3o se recordar de acontecimentos significativos, alvo dos cabe\u00e7alhos dos jornais mais importantes. TENGO tem 34 anos e aspira ser escritor profissional. Escrever faz parte de si e dedica v\u00e1rias horas por dia a esta actividade. \u00c9 professor de Matem\u00e1tica, profiss\u00e3o que exerce com prazer, e escritor a regime parcial. Contudo, n\u00e3o tem aparenta ser uma coisa nem outra. Corpulento, de cabelo curto, com orelhas que parecem duas pequenas couve-flor tem aspecto de lenhador. Isolado da sociedade, vive o seu dia-a-dia da forma que considera ideal: l\u00ea, escreve e passeia.E todas as Sextas encontra-se com a sua amante casada, 10 anos mais velha, para uma tarde de sexo. A sua primeira lembran\u00e7a data do seu primeiro ano de vida e ocorre-lhe, sem aviso pr\u00e9vio, em v\u00e1rios momentos menos prop\u00edcios do seu dia-a-dia. Contudo, como \u00e9 algo com que se habituou a viver, reage como se estivesse a ter um ataque de enjoo do qual rapidamente se recomp\u00f5e.Uma quest\u00e3o permanece desde sempre sem resposta: ser\u00e1 que esta lembran\u00e7a t\u00e3o remota \u00e9 real ou o seu c\u00e9rebro criou-a por outros motivos? Neste momento da sua vida -lhe feita uma proposta que, apesar de ir contra a sua moral, \u00e9 irrecus\u00e1vel. \u00b4 FUKA-ERI \u00e9 uma rapariga com uma personalidade especial: reservada e muito t\u00edmida, raramente se deixa ouvir. Quando falar, comunica por poucas palavras e um facto curioso \u00e9 que nunca faz a devida pontua\u00e7\u00e3o. Isto \u00e9, quando coloca uma quest\u00e3o, diz-o na forma de afirma\u00e7\u00e3o. O seu nome verdadeiro \u00e9 Eriko Fukada e tem apenas 17 anos.Escreveu um romance intitulado \"A Cris\u00e1lida de Ar\", o qual tem um grande potencial,segundo Tengo. O aspirante a escritor profissional tenta convencer o seu chefe da qualidade desta obra. Contudo, a escolha de palavras, as estruturas fr\u00e1sicas e a gram\u00e1tica s\u00e3o terr\u00edveis.Tengo vai ter a possibilidade de reescrever toda a obra sozinho, a qual depois ir\u00e1 concorrer a dois pr\u00e9mios liter\u00e1rios importantes. O seu chefe, um editor profissional experiente, tem a certeza que desta forma Fuka-Eri ter\u00e1 sucesso: a jun\u00e7\u00e3o de dois autores num novo e melhorado escritor. Estas s\u00e3o as tr\u00eas personagens principais do primeiro livro da trilogia 1Q84. O Haruki Murakami \u00e9 um dos meus autores preferidos desde os meus 16 anos, quando li pela primeira vez uma obra sua: \"Kafka \u00e0 Beira Mar\". Desde ent\u00e3o tive a oportunidade de ler todos os seus livros publicados em Portugal e uma coisa posso dizer: a qualidade dos seus romances \u00e9 ineg\u00e1vel. Este autor tem um estilo muito pr\u00f3prio e \u00fanico. A sua capacidade de conjugar v\u00e1rias realidades paralelas, leva-nos a reflectir sobre a nossa pr\u00f3pria exist\u00eancia; sobre o que \u00e9 ou n\u00e3o \u00e9 real? E afinal, o que \u00e9 podemos chamar de real? Quais as caracter\u00edsticas que \u00e9 preciso possuir para fazermos parte desta realidade? A hist\u00f3ria do \"1Q84\" tem dois fios condutores: a hist\u00f3ria de Aomame e a hist\u00f3ria de Tengo. Ambas s\u00e3o contadas por cap\u00edtulos intercalados entre si. Este pormenor provocou sentimentos contradit\u00f3rios em mim. Por um lado ficava frustrada porque queria saber qual o pr\u00f3ximo passo de Aomame, mas tamb\u00e9m me sentia ansiosa porque podia finalmente ler a continua\u00e7\u00e3o das ac\u00e7\u00f5es de Tengo. Outro detalhe que contribuiu para despertar ainda mais o meu interesse ao longo da leitura foi o facto de estar acompanhar quatro hist\u00f3rias diferentes: as hist\u00f3rias de Aomame e Tengo; a hist\u00f3ria geral do livro que inclu\u00ed ambas as personagens e por \u00faltimo a hist\u00f3ria do livro escrito por Fuka-Eri. \"Cris\u00e1lia no Ar\" \u00e9 um livro fict\u00edcio que despertou em mim, at\u00e9 ao momento, mais sentimentos do que v\u00e1rios livros concretos. O humor est\u00e1 muito presente na narrativa, como em todos os seus livros. Um humor inteligente, que por vezes me faz reler a mesma passagem vezes sem conta. Para al\u00e9m de ser dotado de uma capacidade de escrita excepcional, Haruki Murakmi possui vastos conhecimentos na \u00e1rea do cinema. Neste livro s\u00e3o in\u00fameras as refer\u00eancias cinematogr\u00e1ficas, que comprovam, mais uma vez, os vastos conhecimentos culturais do autor. Este detalhe do 1Q84 fez-me sentir mais pr\u00f3xima do escritor, uma vez que vi os filmes por ele mencionados e conhe\u00e7o os autores e realizadores que inseriu na sua narrativa. (Um aparte, mas n\u00e3o menos importante, Haruki Murakami \u00e9 apaixonado pelo g\u00e9nero cinematogr\u00e1fico noir, que \u00e9 nada mais nada menos, do que o meu g\u00e9nero cinematogr\u00e1fico e liter\u00e1rio preferido. Como consequ\u00eancia, todos os seus livros t\u00eam, em maior ou menos grau, influ\u00eancias deste estilo especifico - contudo adaptado com o toque pessoal do nosso mestre do surreal.) Este livro \u00e9 apenas o inicio de um hist\u00f3ria que se desenvolve ao longo de outros dois livros, que eu irei ler nos pr\u00f3ximos dias, como n\u00e3o podia deixar de ser. As quest\u00f5es levantadas pelo autor est\u00e3o em aberto e as personagens encontram-se em fases muito estranhas das suas vidas. \u00c9 curioso, eu como leitora vejo-me confrontada com as realidades diferentes da minha, que me s\u00e3o desconhecidas e reflicto sobre todas as quest\u00f5es que elas levantam; sobre as caracter\u00edsticas que as definem e as palavras que as descrevem. Simultaneamente, as personagens deste livro sublime e poderoso est\u00e3o perante realidades alheias \u00e0 delas e confrontam-se com exactamente os mesmos aspectos do que eu. Recomendo n\u00e3o s\u00f3 este livro, mas sim todas as obras escritas pelo autor Haruki Murakami. Na minha opini\u00e3o, este autor n\u00e3o se insere em nenhum g\u00e9nero especifico: ele criou o seu pr\u00f3prio g\u00e9nero liter\u00e1rios. Possui o dom de oferecer ao leitor momentos de reflex\u00e3o e entretenimento e desperta nele todos os sentimentos poss\u00edveis de serem provocados num ser humano. As suas hist\u00f3rias s\u00e3o mais do que fic\u00e7\u00e3o e as quest\u00f5es com que nos confrontadas passam a fazer parte de n\u00f3s mesmos, da nossa personalidade. Sem d\u00favida alguma, um livro que merece a nossa entrega total. ...more Po \u201eNorveg\u0173 girios\u201c per daug nesusi\u017eav\u0117jusi Murakamiu pa\u017eint\u012f su jo k\u016bryba buvau pristabd\u017eiusi, bet \u0161i\u0173 met\u0173 i\u0161\u0161\u016bkyje nusprend\u017eiau suteikti jam antr\u0105 \u0161ans\u0105 ir \u0117miausi \u201e1Q84\u201c. Ai\u0161ku, antram \u0161ansui imt trilogij\u0105 sprendimas buvo \u012fdomus, bet tai buvo vienintel\u0117s kitos u\u017estrigusios jo knygos, o dar ta nuoroda \u012f Orvel\u0105.. Planavau blogiausiu atveju perskaityti vien\u0105 ir mesti, bet visgi mano sprendimas pabandyti \u0161\u012f ra\u0161ytoj\u0105 dar kart\u0105 pasiteisino ir, nors i\u0161 karto nepavyks, pabaigsiu visas tris knygas. N Po \u201eNorveg\u0173 girios\u201c per daug nesusi\u017eav\u0117jusi Murakamiu pa\u017eint\u012f su jo k\u016bryba buvau pristabd\u017eiusi, bet \u0161i\u0173 met\u0173 i\u0161\u0161\u016bkyje nusprend\u017eiau suteikti jam antr\u0105 \u0161ans\u0105 ir \u0117miausi \u201e1Q84\u201c. Ai\u0161ku, antram \u0161ansui imt trilogij\u0105 sprendimas buvo \u012fdomus, bet tai buvo vienintel\u0117s kitos u\u017estrigusios jo knygos, o dar ta nuoroda \u012f Orvel\u0105.. Planavau blogiausiu atveju perskaityti vien\u0105 ir mesti, bet visgi mano sprendimas pabandyti \u0161\u012f ra\u0161ytoj\u0105 dar kart\u0105 pasiteisino ir, nors i\u0161 karto nepavyks, pabaigsiu visas tris knygas. Nes nu pirma neatved\u0117 niekur kur tik\u0117jausi ir matomai iki to dar ilgas kelias, o pasiekti t\u0105 pabaig\u0105 norisi. Mane g\u0105sdino tie kiek klaidinantys komentarai, kad \u201eNorveg\u0173 giria\u201c jo realisti\u0161kiausia knyga. Maniau, kad jeigu jau ta nesu\u017eav\u0117jo, tai toliau bus dar blogiau. Bet nu 1Q84 pirma knyga yra bent jau pana\u0161aus realisti\u0161kumo lygio, bet ties\u0105 sakant man asmeni\u0161kai tie visi keisti dalykai \u010dia net atrod\u0117 artimesni ir tikresni. Mistika \u010dia labai tampriai susijusi su realybe, j\u0173 tiesiog negalima atskirti. Man tai visose knygose su fantastikos elementais yra labai svarbu \u2013 tas ir kuria TIKRO nors kiek kitokio pasaulio iliuzij\u0105. 1Q84 pirma knyga man primin\u0117 Allende \u201eEv\u0105 Lun\u0105\u201c \u2013 visas romanas tai dviej\u0173 nutolusi\u0173 likim\u0173 pasakojimas su pa\u017eadu juos sujungti. Apskritai a\u0161 Murakamio k\u016bryb\u0105 kol kas turb\u016bt vadin\u010diau moderniu magi\u0161kuoju realizmu, nes nu j\u012f tikrai primena \u2013 tir\u0161tas pasakojimas, \u012fpinant dramati\u0161k\u0173 praeities istorij\u0173, m\u016bs\u0173 pasaulis, kuris atrodo realus, bet kartu ir nelabai; ir vis\u0105 laik\u0105 persekioja mistini\u0173 dalyk\u0173 debesis, kuris niekaip nepraki\u016bra. Bent jau neprakiuro pirmoje knygoje. Mistini\u0173 dalyk\u0173 u\u017euominos par\u0117jo i\u0161 dviej\u0173 ne itin stabilios psichikos \u017emoni\u0173 \u2013 \u017eudik\u0117s, kurios protas toks racionalus, kad dalyk\u0105, jog ji praleido kelis poros met\u0173 senumo \u012fvykius, ji priskyr\u0117 ne savo smegen\u0173 defektui, o pasaulio krizei, ir jaunos traumuotos merginos, para\u0161iusios apie tai knyg\u0105. Kaip jau sakiau, labai stipr\u016bs saitai su realybe \u2013 knyga jau savaime yra fikcija, nors mergina ir sako kad tai tiesa, bet visada yra galimyb\u0117, kad jos trauma tokia gili, kad jinai prisigalvojo mistini\u0173 b\u016btybi\u0173 apsisaugoti. O d\u0117l pirmos nu tai pirmiausia jos mintijimas tek\u0117jo tokia vaga, kad sunku nesutikti su \u012f\u017evalgomis, o kita, na su ja irgi gali b\u016bti visoki\u0173 psichologini\u0173 niuans\u0173. O tada, kai tie nukrypimai nuo realyb\u0117s pradeda jungtis ir rodos jau pakylam \u012f kit\u0105 dimensij\u0105, atsiranda detektyvo elementai ir tarsi stipri gravitacija laiko vis\u0105 pasakojim\u0105 prie \u017eem\u0117s. Mane kaip ekstremaliai racional\u0173 \u017emog\u0173 visada jaudina tas realyb\u0117s ir mistikos santykis. \u0160\u012f knyga dar kart\u0105 leido susim\u0105styti apie tai, kaip vis d\u0117l to \u017emogus gali patik\u0117ti dalykais, kuriuos vis\u0105 gyvenim\u0105 laik\u0117 ne\u012fmanomais. Kaip ilgai i\u0161silaiko abejon\u0117s, koki\u0173 \u012frodym\u0173 reikia? Ko man reikt\u0173, kad patik\u0117\u010diau? O ir \u0161iaip, galiausiai akimirkai susim\u0105stai, kas gi visgi yra ne\u012fmanoma? Ir \u0161itoje knygoje veik\u0117jai b\u016btent tai ir neretai daro \u2013 m\u0105sto apie dalykus, kurie galvoje netelpa ir nesuprasi jie bando ai\u0161kinti visk\u0105 racionaliai ar jau patik\u0117jo, kad yra b\u016btybi\u0173, kurios skiriasi nuo \u017emoni\u0173 ar kad praeitis gali keistis. Bendrai tai \u010dia ir \u0161iaip daug psichologini\u0173 niuans\u0173, ypa\u010d seksualini\u0173 nukrypim\u0173 \u2013 na gal ne itin rimt\u0173, bet visgi keistok\u0173. Ir apie juos Murakamis da\u017enai ir tiesmukai kalba. Vyras, kur\u012f i\u0161tinka priepuoliai nuo dviej\u0173 met\u0173 prisiminimo apie mamos glamones su kitu vyru ir moteris, kuri\u0105 geismas aplank\u0117 vien\u0105 vyr\u0105 nu\u017eud\u017eius ir kuri\u0105 traukia vien praplik\u0119 vyrukai su tinkama galvos forma. Ir \u017einoma, visa tai stipriai siejasi su vaikyste, joje patirtomis traumomis ir autorius visa tai rimtai gromuliuoja. Stipriai su viskuo visur ir visada siejasi smurto prie\u0161 moteris, vaik\u0173 i\u0161naudojimo ir smegen\u0173 plovimo temos. Ka\u017ekaip v\u0117l \u0161it\u0105 knyg\u0105 norisi vadinti tamsia ir ni\u016bria, bet ka\u017ekaip kol kas dar nepri\u0117jau tokios i\u0161vados, tiesiog ji man primin\u0117 LNK snobo film\u0105 \u2013 smurtas, seksas ir s\u0105mokslas. O jau buities detali\u0173! Niekad nemaniau, kad rasiu knyg\u0105 ir dar rimt\u0105, kuri buit\u012f apra\u0161in\u0117jama tiek pat daug kiek Suk\u0117s knygose. K\u0105 ji veik\u0117 ryte atsik\u0117lusi, kaip plov\u0117si dantis, kaip gamino valgyti ir kaip lipo kop\u0117\u010diomis. Ne blogai \u010dia ai\u0161ku, tiesiog ne\u012fprasta. Kas man, tiesa, u\u017ekliuvo tai, kad visi ten blogi dalykai ir gyvenimo l\u016b\u017eiai vyksta kaip tik de\u0161imties, beveik visiems. Sutapimai, sutapimai, sutapimai. O gal ir ne? Trumpai tariant, man kol kas patinka. Jau\u010diu, kad viso pasakojimo gijos dar net nepajutau, realiai net ne\u017einau apie k\u0105 skaitau, bet man patinka ir reiks jud\u0117ti pirmyn. ...more This book has a good premise with poor execution. There are some weird yet deeply affecting scenes which kept me reading, but it really doesn't need to be three volumes long; I wonder where his editor was in all of this. The main issue that lets this book down is the dialogue. Maybe it's just how Japanese people speak and it doesn't make sense in translation, but characters frequently talk to each other in a way that seems completely unnatural and out of character. They exchange information they This book has a good premise with poor execution. There are some weird yet deeply affecting scenes which kept me reading, but it really doesn't need to be three volumes long; I wonder where his editor was in all of this. The main issue that lets this book down is the dialogue. Maybe it's just how Japanese people speak and it doesn't make sense in translation, but characters frequently talk to each other in a way that seems completely unnatural and out of character. They exchange information they obviously already know, and on many occasions a character will make a simple statement, and the other will say 'You mean like...', then launch into an extremely elaborate paraphrasing that only the author could be able to make, to which the other will respond 'exactly'. In fact this book could be renamed 'Exactly'. For example, it might go something like this: Character A: \"The rain makes me sad.\" Character B: \"You mean the rain reminds you of your childhood when you weren't allowed to go out and play because your mother was scared you'd catch pneumonia like your older deceased sibling which is why she was an alcoholic and would cry and her tears would look like rain?\" Character A: \"Exactly.\" ...more A chaud, je ne peux gu\u00e8re dire plus que : j'ai ador\u00e9 ce livre. M\u00eame si \u00e0 ce stade, je suis incapable de le classer dans un genre ni m\u00eame s\u00fbre d'avoir encore tout compris/analys\u00e9. Dans ce roman, on suit et on s'attache aux deux personnages. Leurs aventures se d\u00e9roulent en alternance sur chaque chapitre mais ils ont un ennemi commun : une secte mi \u00e9cologiste mi bouddhiste mi sociopathes ( \u00e7a fait trois mi je sais mais il est encore trop t\u00f4t pour trancher !). Ce premier tome, tourn\u00e9 vers les femmes ( A chaud, je ne peux gu\u00e8re dire plus que : j'ai ador\u00e9 ce livre. M\u00eame si \u00e0 ce stade, je suis incapable de le classer dans un genre ni m\u00eame s\u00fbre d'avoir encore tout compris/analys\u00e9. Dans ce roman, on suit et on s'attache aux deux personnages. Leurs aventures se d\u00e9roulent en alternance sur chaque chapitre mais ils ont un ennemi commun : une secte mi \u00e9cologiste mi bouddhiste mi sociopathes ( \u00e7a fait trois mi je sais mais il est encore trop t\u00f4t pour trancher !). Ce premier tome, tourn\u00e9 vers les femmes (femmes opprim\u00e9es, femmes violent\u00e9es et femmes \u00e9prises de justice) met en place l'intrigue sur fonds d'univers parall\u00e8les et de lutte entre le bien et le mal. Plus que l'histoire, c'est la plume de Murakami qui m'enchante encore une fois. Comme le disait tr\u00e8s justement Camille, cet homme a un don pour rendre la vie quotidienne passionnante ! A vrai dire, je la trouve un peu magique. Seul b\u00e9mol, le go\u00fbt de l'auteur pour les r\u00e9p\u00e9titions : on le saura que Aomam\u00e9 n'aime pas ses petits seins ! ...more Primeiro volume devorado. \u00c9 muito dif\u00edcil fazer uma critica a um livro de Murakami. Ou o podemos considerar genial ou simplesmente n\u00e3o ver nada de especial na sua escrita. Eu fa\u00e7o parte daqueles que se deleitam com as hist\u00f3rias e personagens que ele cria. Supostamente passado em 1984 ou num mundo \u00e0 parte (1Q84)conhecemos as duas personagens principais Aomame e Tengo e com o desenrolar do enredo vemos at\u00e9 que ponto as vidas de ambos se cruzam. Em que parte da hist\u00f3ria \u00e9 que pass\u00e1mos al\u00e9m da realid Primeiro volume devorado. \u00c9 muito dif\u00edcil fazer uma critica a um livro de Murakami. Ou o podemos considerar genial ou simplesmente n\u00e3o ver nada de especial na sua escrita. Eu fa\u00e7o parte daqueles que se deleitam com as hist\u00f3rias e personagens que ele cria. Supostamente passado em 1984 ou num mundo \u00e0 parte (1Q84)conhecemos as duas personagens principais Aomame e Tengo e com o desenrolar do enredo vemos at\u00e9 que ponto as vidas de ambos se cruzam. Em que parte da hist\u00f3ria \u00e9 que pass\u00e1mos al\u00e9m da realidade? H\u00e1 uma cr\u00edtica do The New York Times Book Review que n\u00e3o posso deixar de partilhar: \u201cMurakami \u00e9 como um m\u00e1gico que explica o que est\u00e1 fazendo conforme apresenta o truque, e mesmo assim faz parecer que tem poderes sobrenaturais (...) Qualquer um pode contar uma hist\u00f3ria que se pare\u00e7a com um sonho, mas \u00e9 raro o artista, como ele, que nos faz sentir como se n\u00f3s mesmos a estiv\u00e9ssemos sonhando.\u201d ...more Ik vraag me af, ergens diep van binnen, waar Murakami is. Eigenlijk. Stiekem. Dit is geen meesterwerk. Murakami's meesterwerken zijn al geschreven (Kafka op het Strand, Opwindvogelkronieken). Dit is een tegenvaller. Tot nu toe. Op naar Boek II. \u03a4\u03ad\u03bb\u03b5\u03b9\u03bf \u03ba\u03b1\u03b9 \u03c0\u03bf\u03bb\u03cd \u03b5\u03bd\u03b4\u03b9\u03b1\u03c6\u03ad\u03c1\u03bf\u03bd \u03b2\u03b9\u03b2\u03bb\u03af\u03bf! \u039f\u03b9 \u03c7\u03b1\u03c1\u03b1\u03ba\u03c4\u03ae\u03c1\u03b5\u03c2 \u03b5\u03af\u03bd\u03b1\u03b9 \u03bf\u03bb\u03bf\u03ba\u03bb\u03b7\u03c1\u03c9\u03bc\u03ad\u03bd\u03bf\u03b9 \u03ba\u03b1\u03b9 \u03b7 \u03c0\u03c1\u03b1\u03b3\u03bc\u03b1\u03c4\u03b9\u03ba\u03cc\u03c4\u03b7\u03c4\u03b1 \u03bc\u03c0\u03bb\u03ad\u03ba\u03b5\u03c4\u03b1\u03b9 \u03ac\u03c8\u03bf\u03b3\u03b1 \u03bc\u03b5 \u03c6\u03b1\u03bd\u03c4\u03b1\u03c3\u03c4\u03b9\u03ba\u03ac \u03c3\u03c4\u03bf\u03b9\u03c7\u03b5\u03af\u03b1. \u0397 \u03c0\u03bb\u03bf\u03ba\u03ae \u03b4\u03b9\u03b1\u03c1\u03ba\u03ce\u03c2 \u03b1\u03bb\u03bb\u03ac\u03b6\u03b5\u03b9 \u03ba\u03b1\u03b9 \u03bf\u03b9 \u03b5\u03ba\u03c0\u03bb\u03ae\u03be\u03b5\u03b9\u03c2 \u03b4\u03b9\u03b1\u03b4\u03ad\u03c7\u03bf\u03bd\u03c4\u03b1\u03b9 \u03b7 \u03bc\u03af\u03b1 \u03c4\u03b7\u03bd \u03ac\u03bb\u03bb\u03b7. \u03a4\u03bf \u03b5\u03c0\u03cc\u03bc\u03b5\u03bd\u03bf \u03b2\u03b9\u03b2\u03bb\u03af\u03bf \u03c0\u03bf\u03c5 \u03b8\u03b1 \u03b4\u03b9\u03b1\u03b2\u03ac\u03c3\u03c9 \u03b5\u03af\u03bd\u03b1\u03b9 \u03c3\u03af\u03b3\u03bf\u03c5\u03c1\u03b1 \u03c4\u03bf \u03b4\u03b5\u03cd\u03c4\u03b5\u03c1\u03bf \u03ba\u03b1\u03b9 \u03b1\u03bd\u03c5\u03c0\u03bf\u03bc\u03bf\u03bd\u03ce! \u062a\u0639\u0645\u062f\u062a\u064f \u0623\u0646 \u0623\u0628\u0642\u064a\u064e \u0627\u0644\u062b\u0644\u0627\u062b\u064a\u0646 \u0627\u0644\u0635\u0641\u062d\u0629\u064e \u0627\u0644\u0623\u062e\u064a\u0631\u0629 \u0645\u0646 \u0627\u0644\u0631\u0648\u0627\u064a\u0629\u0650 \u0645\u0639\u0644\u0642\u0629\u064b \u0641\u0641\u0627\u0635\u0644\u064f \u0645\u0627 \u0628\u064a\u0646\u0647\u0627 \u0648\u0627\u0644\u0631\u0648\u0627\u064a\u0629\u0650 \u0623\u0631\u0628\u0639\u0648\u0646 \u064a\u0648\u0645\u0627 \u062c\u0639\u0644\u062a\u0646\u064a \u0623\u0633\u062a\u0643\u0646\u0647\u064f \u0645\u0627 \u064a\u0648\u062f\u0651\u064f \u0647\u0627\u0631\u0648\u0643\u064a \u0642\u0648\u0644\u064e\u0647 \u0648\u0644\u0643\u0646 \u0644\u0627 \u0623\u062c\u062f\u064f \u0643\u062b\u064a\u0631\u064e \u0627\u0646\u0637\u0628\u0627\u0639\u064d \u064a\u0645\u0643\u0646\u0646\u064a \u0642\u0648\u0644\u064f\u0647 \u0648\u0627\u0644\u0631\u0648\u0627\u064a\u0629\u064f \u0644\u0645 \u062a\u0643\u062a\u0645\u0644\u0652 \u062d\u064a\u062b \u062c\u0632\u0626\u0627\u0646 \u0645\u0643\u0645\u0644\u0627\u0646\u0650 \u0644\u0647\u0627 4.5/5stars (I have decided to split up my reviews for this book - I'm reading the large, one-volume copy but my review is legit going to be a million pages long, plus I want to be able to talk about each book as I finish it - and I feel like it's fair counting this as 3 books to my good reads goal lol) This first book was WONDERFUL. I deducted a .5 point simply because it was a LITTLE draggy and not too much happened - but the world building, character development and plot set up was SUPERB. In th 4.5/5stars (I have decided to split up my reviews for this book - I'm reading the large, one-volume copy but my review is legit going to be a million pages long, plus I want to be able to talk about each book as I finish it - and I feel like it's fair counting this as 3 books to my good reads goal lol) This first book was WONDERFUL. I deducted a .5 point simply because it was a LITTLE draggy and not too much happened - but the world building, character development and plot set up was SUPERB. In this volume we are introduced to our two main characters/main story lines. First there is the woman Aomame who is a professional assassin who is able to kill people by driving a needle into a certain place on their neck - a place that, for whatever reason, she is able to detect on people while most others don't even know it exists. Then there is Tengo; a struggling author who gets roped into a crazy scheme of rewriting a young girl's story to be turned into a big-shot novel. At the beginning of this story, Aomame is stuck in traffic while on her way to an important meeting, when her taxi driver tells her of a secret passage down a phone booth that will take her to a street where she can catch a bus or subway. The taxi driver leaves her with a message; \"After you DO something like that, the everyday LOOK of things might seem to change a little. Things may look DIFFERENT to you than they did before. But don't let appearances fool you. There's always only one reality.\" and thus, Aomame is thrust into a world with two moons, sequences of events she never remembers happening, the existence of 'little people' and dozens of other characters who all affect her life. Now, I can't tell you which story I liked better. I'm quite wishy washy on Aomame's chapters - sometimes I FUCKING LOVED THEM and sometimes I really REALLY disliked her. Aomame is an extremely strong, badass lady - but... also doesn't consider herself a feminist and also kind of bad mouths feminists and thinks the only way girls can fight against men is by kicking them in the balls. But then all the sex positive stuff is great and just her overarching plot line is REALLY interesting, but I'm still not 100% sure about her as a character. I also RAELLY love Fuka-Eri. Tengo's storyline isn't as interesting, except for the parts about Fuka-Eri and her past and all the crazy, surreal, magical-realism stuff that has happened to her. I'm also just SO CURIOUS as to how the timelines are going to connect because atm we KINDA know the connection between Tengo and Aomame and a few little events, but so far I'm still not totally sure how it's going to come together. overall, really loved the beginning of this story!! ...more \u0623\u0642\u0648\u0644 \u0625\u064a\u0647 \u0628\u0633 \u0648\u0644\u0627 \u0625\u064a\u0647 !! \u0645\u0648\u0631\u0627\u0643\u0627\u0645\u064a \u0645\u062c\u0646\u0648\u0646 \u0648\u062f\u064a \u062d\u0642\u064a\u0642\u0629 \u0645\u064a\u062e\u062a\u0644\u0641\u0634 \u0648\u0645\u062a\u0642\u0627\u0628\u0644\u0648\u0634 \u0641\u064a \u0627\u0644\u062c\u0632\u0621 \u0627\u0644\u062a\u0627\u0646\u064a \u0645\u0634 \u0647\u0640 \u062a\u0641\u0627\u062c\u0623 :D \u0637\u064a\u0628 \u0641\u0649 \u0627\u0644\u062a\u0627\u0644\u062a \u0623\u0648 \u0645\u064a\u062a\u0642\u0627\u0628\u0644\u0648\u0634 \u062e\u0627\u0644\u0635 \u0645\u0645\u0643\u0646 .. \u0645\u0639 \u0647\u0627\u0631\u0648\u0643\u064a \u0643\u0644 \u0634\u0626 \u0645\u0645\u0643\u0646 \u060c \u0641\u0643\u0631\u0629 \u0625\u0646 \u0627\u0644\u0643\u0627\u062a\u0628 \u064a\u062f\u062e\u0644\u0646\u0627 \u0641\u0649 \u0631\u0648\u0627\u064a\u062a\u064a\u0646 \u062c\u0648\u0627 \u0631\u0648\u0627\u064a\u0629 \u0641\u0643\u0631\u0629 \u062c\u0627\u0645\u062f\u0629 \u0622\u0647 \u0645\u0634 \u062c\u062f\u064a\u062f\u0629 \u0628\u0633 \u062c\u0627\u0645\u062f\u0629 \u060c \u0628\u0633 \u0647\u0627\u0631\u0648\u0643\u064a \u0645\u0648\u0631\u0627\u0643\u0627\u0645\u064a \u0637\u0648\u0644 \u0627\u0644\u0631\u0648\u0627\u064a\u0629 \u0634\u0627\u063a\u0644\u0646\u0627 \u062a\u0641\u0643\u064a\u0631\u0646\u0627 \u0628\u0640 \u062d\u0627\u062c\u0629 \u0648\u0627\u062d\u062f\u0629 \u0628\u0633 : \u0647\u0645\u0627 \u0625\u0632\u0627\u064a \u0647\u0640 \u064a\u062a\u0642\u0627\u0628\u0644\u0648 !\u061f \u0622\u0647 \u0641\u0649 \u0627\u0644\u0646\u0647\u0627\u064a\u0629 \u0628\u062f\u0623\u062a \u0627\u062c\u0645\u0639 \u0627\u0644\u062e\u064a\u0648\u0637 \u0644\u0643\u0646 \u0628\u0631\u0636\u0648 \u062e\u064a\u0648\u0637 \u0645\u0639\u0642\u062f\u0629 \u0645\u062d\u062a\u0627\u062c\u0629 \u0635\u0628\u0631 \u0648 \u062a\u0641\u0643\u064a\u0631 \u0648 \u0646\u0638\u0631\u0629 \u0644\u0640 \u0642\u062f\u0627\u0627\u0627\u0627\u0627\u0627\u0627\u0627\u0627\u0627\u0645 \u0634\u0648\u064a\u0629 \u0643\u062a\u0627\u0631 \u060c \u0637\u0628\u0639\u0627\u064b \u0647\u062a\u062c\u0646\u0646 \u0639\u0644\u0649 \u0627\u0644\u062c\u0632\u0621 \u0627\u0644\u062a\u0627\u0646\u064a \u0648\u062f\u064a \u0645\u0641\u064a\u0647\u0627\u0634 \u0643\u0644\u0627\u0645 \u060c \u0648\u0643\u0640 \u0639\u0627\u062f\u0629 \u0647\u0627\u0631\u0648\u0643\u064a \u0645\u0648\u0631\u0627\u0643\u0627\u0645\u064a \u0644\u0645\u0627 \u0628\u062e\u0644\u0635 \u0644\u064a\u0647 \u0623\u064a \u0643\u062a\u0627\u0628 \u0628\u064a\u0633\u064a\u0628\u0646\u064a \u0641\u064a \u062d\u0627\u0644\u0629 \u0645\u0633\u062e\u0631\u0629 \u0627\u0644\u0644\u064a \u0647\u064a : \u0644\u0627 \u064a\u0627\u0631\u0627\u0627\u0627\u0627\u0627\u0627\u0627\u0627\u0627\u062c\u0644 \u0647\u064a \u0628\u0642\u062a \u0643\u062f\u0627 \u060c \u0647\u0648 \u0625\u064a\u0647 \u0627\u0644\u0644\u0649 \u062d\u0635\u0644 \u060c \u0647\u064a \u062e\u0644\u0635\u062a \u060c \u0637\u0628 \u0625\u064a\u0647 \u0628\u0642\u0627 \u060c \u0648\u0623\u0645\u0633\u0643 \u0623\u062e\u0631 \u0635\u0641\u062d\u0629 \u0648\u0623\u0634\u0648\u0641\u0647\u0627 \u064a\u0645\u0643\u0646 \u0645\u0644\u0632\u0648\u0642 \u0641\u064a\u0647\u0627 \u0635\u0641\u062d\u0629 \u062a\u0627\u0646\u064a\u0629 \u0644\u0639\u0644 \u0648\u0639\u0633\u0649 \u0627\u0644\u0635\u0641\u062d\u0629 \u062f\u064a \u062a\u0631\u064a\u062d \u0642\u0644\u0628\u064a \u0648 \u0639\u0642\u0644\u064a \u060c \u0623\u0644\u0627\u0642\u064a\u0647\u0627 \u0623\u062e\u0631 \u0635\u0641\u062d\u0629 \u060c \u0637\u0628 \u0623\u0645\u0633\u0643 \u0627\u0644\u0643\u062a\u0627\u0628 \u0648 \u0623\u0641\u0636\u0644 \u0628\u0635\u0627\u0644\u0629 \u0648\u0644\u0627 \u0627\u0644\u0644\u0649 \u0628\u064a\u062d\u0636\u0631\u0648 \u0639\u0641\u0627\u0631\u064a\u062a \u064a\u0645\u0643\u0646 \u0623\u064a \u062d\u0627\u062c\u0629 \u062a\u062d\u0635\u0644 \u060c \u0628\u0631\u0636\u0648 \u0645\u0641\u064a\u0634 :D \u0627\u0644\u0631\u0627\u062c\u0644 \u062f\u0627 \u0645\u062c\u0646\u0648\u0646 \u0628\u0643\u0644 \u0645\u0627 \u062a\u062d\u0645\u0644\u0629 \u0627\u0644\u0643\u0644\u0645\u0629 \u0645\u0646 \u0645\u0639\u0627\u0646\u064a \u0628\u0639\u0634\u0642 \u062c\u0646\u0648\u0646\u0629 \u0627\u0644\u0631\u0648\u0627\u064a\u0629 5 \u0646\u062c\u0648\u0645 \u0648 \u0628\u0640 \u0625\u0643\u062a\u0633\u0627\u062d . \u0642\u0645\u0631\u0627\u0646 \u0641\u0649 \u0639\u0627\u0644\u0645 \u0648\u0627\u062d\u062f !! \u0645\u0645\u0643\u0646 \u0644\u064a\u0647 \u0644\u0623 . ...more \u0623\u064a\u0646\u0639\u0645 ... \u0623\u0631\u0628\u0639\u0629 \u0646\u062c\u0648\u0645 \u0631\u063a\u0645 \u0623\u0646 \u0627\u0644\u0643\u062a\u0627\u0628 \u0643\u0627\u0646 \u0645\u0632\u0639\u062c\u0627 \u062d\u062f \u0627\u0644\u0635\u0631\u0627\u062e \u0641\u064a \u0627\u0644\u0628\u062f\u0627\u064a\u0629 ... \u0647\u0630\u0627 \u0627\u0644\u0647\u0627\u0631\u0648\u0643\u064a \u064a\u062a\u0648\u063a\u0644 \u0648 \u064a\u062a\u0633\u0631\u0628 \u0648 .... \u064a\u0639\u062c\u064a\u0643 \u0641\u064a \u0627\u0644\u0646\u0647\u0627\u064a\u0629 .... \u0645\u0631\u0627\u062c\u0639\u0629 \u0623\u0637\u0648\u0644 \u0641\u064a\u0645\u0627 \u0628\u0639\u062f .... \u0631\u0628\u0645\u0627 .... :) \u201cKetajaman batin tidak pernah lahir dari lingkungan yang nyaman.\u201d (Tengo \u2013 h.30) Aomame merasa kehilangan momen ketika menyadari perubahan dengan seragam dan senjata Beretta Model 92 yang digunakan polisi. Ingatannya sama sekali tidak dapat menangkap peristiwa baku tembak di Danau Motosu yang menyebabkan perubahan tersebut, yang rasa-rasanya tidak mungkin dia lewatkan beritanya. Komponen dirinya pun seperti mengalami keanehan sejak mendengarkan Sinfonietta karya Janacek dalam sebuah taksi. Hari \u201cKetajaman batin tidak pernah lahir dari lingkungan yang nyaman.\u201d (Tengo \u2013 h.30) Aomame merasa kehilangan momen ketika menyadari perubahan dengan seragam dan senjata Beretta Model 92 yang digunakan polisi. Ingatannya sama sekali tidak dapat menangkap peristiwa baku tembak di Danau Motosu yang menyebabkan perubahan tersebut, yang rasa-rasanya tidak mungkin dia lewatkan beritanya. Komponen dirinya pun seperti mengalami keanehan sejak mendengarkan Sinfonietta karya Janacek dalam sebuah taksi. Hari yang aneh! \u201cJarum menembus kulit, menusuk titik tertentu di bagian bawah otak, dan menghentikan jantung sewajar memadamkan api lilin dengan sekali tiup. \u2026 Hanya Aomame yang mampu melakukannya, \u2026 karena ujung jarinya memiliki indera istimewa\u201d (h. 61) Keahlian istimewa Aomame dan ingatan tentang nasib sahabat baiknya membuatnya menyetujui pekerjaan dari Wanita Tua. Pekerjaan membunuh pria-pria tak termaafkan yang dengan seenaknya melakukan kekerasan. \u201cdimana garis batas antara kegilaan dan sesuatu yang menyerupai kegilaan, Aomame tidak bisa melihatnya. Lagipula orang-orang yang dikirim ke dunia nun jauh oleh Aomame bersama wanita tua itu adalah para laki-laki yang, dipandang dari sudut mana pun, sama sekali tidak patut diberi belas kasihan.\u201d (h.366) Selain alur Aomame, penulis juga menyuguhkan alur Tengo, meski kaitan keduanya baru akan ditemukan menjelang akhir cerita jilid pertama. Tengo seorang penulis, mendapatkan tantangan dari Komatsu, untuk menulis ulang sebuah novel berjudul Kepompong Udara. Sebuah novel, dari naskah yang masuk di sayembara sastra, yang menarik bagi Tengo maupun Komatsu, si editor kawakan. Penulisan ulang ini menyalahi aturan tapi rasa penasaran terus menggempur diri Tengo. \u201cYang kita lakukan sekadar mencoba memperbaiki karangan bercacat di sana sini yang ditulis oleh seorang siswa SMA agar menjadi karya yang lebih bermutu. Apa salahnya? Bukankah lebih dari cukup kalau karya hasil kerja sama kita bermutu tinggi dan dapat dinikmati banyak pembaca?\u201d (Komatsu \u2013 h. 41) Pertemuan Tengo dan Fuka-Eri, si penulis Kepompong Udara, semakin memperumit keadaan karena Fukada, nama aslinya, mengidap disleksia. \u201cFuka-Eri menderita disleksia dan tidak dapat membaca buku secara normal. Orang yang menderita disleksia pada dasarnya tidak dapat membaca dan menulis. Dapat dikatakan tidak ada masalah pda kecerdasannya, tapi butuh waktu lama untuk membaca.\u201d Jika kondisi Fukada terungkap, maka penulisan ulang novel yang cemerlang tidak akan ada gunanya. Namun, penerbitan Kepompong Udara harus terus dilakukan demi mendapatkan kepastian tentang keberadaan orangtua Fukada. Profesor, wali Fukada, mengungkap sebuah sejarah orangtua Fukada yang sampai saat ini tidak diketahui nasibnya. Novel Kepompong Udara dianggap sebagai salah satu jalan memancing media untuk selanjutnya, bisa menemukan keberadaan orangtua Fukada. Tujuan lebih besarnya lagi, adalah menyibak misteri komune Sakigake. \u201cCerita yang menarik. Sangat sugestif. Tetapi sugesti apakah itu, sejujurnya saya tidak mengerti. Kambing buta bermakna apa, Orang Kecil itu apa, atau Kepompong Udara itu melambangkan apa.\u201d Kedatangan seorang gadis kecil di tempat penampungan Wanita Tua, menawarkan sebuah pekerjaan baru yang mengaitkannya dengan sejarah Sakigake. Jadi, secara perlahan tokoh Aomame dan Tengo digiring ke satu titik yang sama yaitu misteri komune Sakigake. \u201cApa yang sedang terjadi dalam komune, sama sekali tidak dapat diterka dari luar. Kalau Akebono yang militan berprinsip menutup diri, masih bisa dipahami. Tapi Sakigake hanya menjalankan pertanian organic dengan damai, \u2026 komune itu kelihatan bagaikan benteng.\u201d (h.238) Terlepas dari adegan-adegan vulgarnya, novel ini sangat menarik berbicara tentang banyak hal, sejarah, isu politik, kehidupan, misteri, kekerasan seksual, hukum, psikologis, sehingga membuat novel ini terkesan padat dan rumit. Settingnya mengambil tahun 1984 dan sepertinya terinspirasi oleh novel George Orwell, yang berjudul 1984. \u201cNovel 1984, George Orwell menampilkan tokoh diktator yang disebut \u2018Bung Besar\u2019. Tentu saja alegori Stalinisme. Kemudian istilah \u2018Bung Besar\u2019 menjadi salah satu ikon social sejak terbitnya novel itu. Itu keberhasilan Orwell. Namun pada tahun 1984 yang nyata ini, Bung Besar sudah terlampau terkenal, terlampau mudah dilihat. Sebagai gantinya, mucul Orang Kecil.\u201d (Profesor \u2013 h. 393) Meski dipenuhi misteri dan kekelaman, \u2018hubungan yang masih tertutup\u2019 antara Aomame dan Tengo terasa menjadi pemanis dalam alur. Mengingat buku ini masih jilid pertama, sudah pasti isinya semacam \u2018pengantar\u2019 untuk menemukan plot besar dalam cerita. Komune Sakigake, Orangtua Fukada, Kelanjutan nasib Novel Kepompong Udara, Pelarian Fukada, Orang Kecil, bahkan apakah Aomame dan Tengo akan bertemu, semuanya masih menyimpan rasa penasaran yang besar. \u201cProfesor punya kekuatan besar dan kebijaksanaan dalam. Tapi Orang Kecil juga punya kebijaksanaan dalam dan kekuatan besar tidak kalah sama Profesor. Hati-hati di dalam hutam. Hal yang penting ada di dalam hutan dan di dalam hutan ada Orang Kecil. Untuk tidak dicederai Orang Kecil harus menemukan sesuatu yang tidak dimiliki Orang kecil.\u201d (Fukada \u2013 h.500) ...more This is a book that best resembles life. Two worlds: the one that is and the one that should be. It is a lesson that we should all learn from this almost sci-fi book, we should take more time in perusing what we really care about in life and just use the best of this world to do it, without overthinking, without atonements. It is also a mirror of our berm in two worlds that are best together: the one we are in and the one we have for ourselves just to create one another over and over again, cons This is a book that best resembles life. Two worlds: the one that is and the one that should be. It is a lesson that we should all learn from this almost sci-fi book, we should take more time in perusing what we really care about in life and just use the best of this world to do it, without overthinking, without atonements. It is also a mirror of our berm in two worlds that are best together: the one we are in and the one we have for ourselves just to create one another over and over again, consequently to give ourselves and others another chance. As human beings we are the ones that before doing something we most of the times find any arguments to just stop acting, this is who we are but we can have another world of being what we want to be, the most overriding what we can be, by not taking into consideration the drawing power that allures us to pain and futility. This is the main reason that makes me want to continue reading this lengthy book, like Fukaeri said:' nothing is what it seems to be', but you just have to read it to find out by yourself. A love story at its roots, but mostly a love story with yourself and only then the communion with another person. How love can pass us by and then drawing us back together as fast as it appeared. This is emotionally pumping, you can have what you want just in certain moments, but if you keep the magnetism alive in your heart those moments can be attracted by you. It is that kind of a story that happens only in your mind, you want it so badly that you can't stop feeling that this is the reality not what you already have. I perceive Fukaeri and Tengo relationship as a unity between Tengo and himself, as a way of keeping the magnetism still despite the hater towards himself of not doing something he always wanted to do. To be with the one he loves. Haruki Murakami is a master in revealing this shivering love story in parallel with the loving of yourself and how compulsory this is. I will cry at the end. I love manifold things about Haruki Murakami's profound (directing as many sort of beings as possible, every single time with his/her way of thinking, behaving, dressing, needing, protecting their secrets), yet foreseeable way of writing (you just know that something detrimental should happen to X or Y, but being entangled by words you just wait for Murakami to unroll his mundane magic). His books always have the same scheme: the introductory description (that has in my case a tremendous undisturbed influence, making me want to be there and stare), the middle: characters dropping right in the middle with their individual impetus, you just want something to happen but nothing happens; THEN at the end of 'the middle', a trigger, and they all link somehow, having something in share, beautifully connected. Every other character that takes part in that 'schematic tree of ordered shuddery pasts, futures, presents, whatever' are 'benevolent rams' which/who amplify the whole story and empower others. This is the greatest rapture: to read it without obtrusions and reveal by every word another world with its own soul. By the way his characters avow themselves, therefore lumping together, I can say that reading Murakami is mesmerizing, you don't even care that you surmised one event or another, you can not even admit it to yourself that you did it. There is a plan in his mind of giving the accurate information just when you need it as not to get stultified. That's because there are so many kindred opinions of so many dissimilar people that it might get pretty repetitive at times. By this, he contrives to make it all coruscating. I love the way Murakami makes me feel: snuggy, addicted, in polish, at ease with myself first of all and then with others. After reading him I just want to be that kind of sagacious person not only in theory but practically speaking (he caught me right on that foot, this is my state of mind at the moment), the one that knows things and how to make the best of them all. I pressume this is the case by and large desired by every character implied. They all have their own life, ways of spending it which make it so unruffled yet without choice nagging, questions over question, but choose to let emotions, love and their wholly self to sit in state. I did find as well philosophical meanings, actually this is above all a type of book that can teach you more than it shows. You can plump for a little of every character, the essential is to like yourself in the end, to draw close your world (1Q84) to the real world. In other words to be who you want to be and let only yourself in charge. Haruki Murakami is one of the few writers I would love to reread someday, just to see my reaction pinpointing my old self after opening out. The rest of the book is well written as well, mysterious, visionary, full with sensations and visually spellbinding. It is written in a simple way, not hard to understand in words but hard to keep track of its fathomless layer that is empathy. ...more Well that's not how I imagined the first book to end! I'll definitely want to read the next books in the series soon. The story is told from the PoV of Tengo and Aomame. They both live completely different lives and are seemingly not connected to each other. Tengo is a math teacher and a freelance writer. He is asked to rewrite a book written by a teenager, Fuka Eri. This was done so the girl could win the 'New Author's Prize'. Involving himself in this proves to be dangerous and it alters his li Well that's not how I imagined the first book to end! I'll definitely want to read the next books in the series soon. The story is told from the PoV of Tengo and Aomame. They both live completely different lives and are seemingly not connected to each other. Tengo is a math teacher and a freelance writer. He is asked to rewrite a book written by a teenager, Fuka Eri. This was done so the girl could win the 'New Author's Prize'. Involving himself in this proves to be dangerous and it alters his life. Aomame is a gym teacher/personal trainer... And she undertakes some special tasks by one of her clients as well. She is a meticulous person and when she noticed changes and heard something that had happened and she didn't know about it- she questions herself. She is usually careful and attentive about everything. Not even sure of the world she is living in anymore, she dubs the time she is living in as 1Q84 instead of the supposed year 1984, and hence, the title of the book. Murakami manages to weave the stories of Tengo and Aomame, which are worlds apart, and brings them together in the world of 1Q84. There are a few other things I'd like to say about this book but I'll wait until I finish the entire trilogy before I unravel my thoughts. All in all, I have nothing to complain about the book. I love everything about it: The characters, the story, the prose, the well formed plot, the surrealism. That said, I can't wait to see how Murakami weaves more magic between these characters in the next two books! ...more \u0644\u0627 \u0623\u0648\u062f \u0627\u0644\u062a\u0639\u062c\u0644 \u0628\u064a\u0646 \u0627\u0644\u0634\u062e\u0635\u064a\u0627\u062a \u0627\u0644\u062b\u0644\u0627\u062b\u0629 \u0648\u0627\u0644\u062c\u0631\u0623\u0629 \u0641\u064a \u0633\u0631\u062f \u0627\u0644\u0623\u062d\u062f\u0627\u062b \u0644\u0645 \u062a\u0643\u0646 \u063a\u0627\u0626\u0628\u0629 \u0641\u064a \u0647\u0630\u0627 \u0627\u0644\u0639\u0645\u0644 1Q84 \u0646\u0628\u062f\u0627 \u0628\u0639\u0646\u0648\u0627\u0646 \u0627\u0644\u0631\u0648\u0627\u064a\u0629 \u062d\u0631\u0641 Q \u064a\u0631\u0645\u0632 \u0627\u0644\u0649 \u0627\u0644\u0633\u0624\u0627\u0644 \u0641\u0628\u0637\u0644\u0629 \u0627\u0644\u0631\u0648\u0627\u064a\u0629 \u0627\u0648\u0645\u0627\u0645\u0629 \u0623\u0635\u0628\u062d\u062a \u0644\u0627\u062a\u062f\u0631\u0643 \u0645\u062c\u0645\u0644 \u0627\u0644\u0627\u062d\u062f\u0627\u062b \u0627\u0644\u062a\u064a \u062a\u0642\u0639 \u0645\u0646 \u062d\u0648\u0644\u0647\u0627 \u0648\u062a\u0631\u0649 \u0623\u0646\u0647\u0627 \u0623\u0635\u0628\u062d\u062a \u0641\u064a \u0639\u0627\u0644\u0645 \u0623\u062e\u0631 \u0641\u0627\u062e\u062a\u0631\u0639\u062a \u0647\u0630\u0627 \u0627\u0644\u0639\u0627\u0645. \u0627\u0648\u0645\u0627\u0645\u0629 \u0645\u062f\u0631\u0628\u0629 \u0644\u062f\u064a\u0647\u0627 \u0645\u0647\u0646\u0629 \u062e\u0637\u064a\u0631\u0629 \u0644\u0643\u0646\u0647\u0627 \u0644\u0627\u062a\u0642\u0631 \u0644\u0627 \u0623\u0648\u062f \u0627\u0644\u062a\u0639\u062c\u0644 \u0628\u0643\u062a\u0627\u0628\u0629 \u0627\u0644\u0645\u0631\u0627\u062c\u0639\u0629 \u0644\u0625\u0646 \u0627\u0644\u0631\u0648\u0627\u064a\u0629 \u0646\u0627\u0642\u0635\u0629 \u0648\u0644\u0645 \u062a\u0643\u0645\u0644 \u0628\u0639\u062f \u0628\u0627\u0646\u062a\u0638\u0627\u0631 \u0628\u0642\u064a\u0629 \u0627\u0644\u0623\u062c\u0632\u0627\u0621 \u0645\u0646\u0647\u0627 \u0648\u0644\u0643\u0646 \u0644\u0627\u0645\u0627\u0646\u0639 \u0623\u0646 \u0627\u0639\u0637\u064a \u0645\u0648\u062c\u0632\u0627\u064b \u0645\u0628\u0633\u0637 \u0639\u0646 \u0627\u0644\u0631\u0648\u0627\u064a\u0629 \u0628\u0634\u0643\u0644 \u0639\u0627\u0645 \u0639\u0627\u0644\u0645 \u0647\u0630\u0627 \u0627\u0644\u0643\u0627\u062a\u0628 \u0645\u0644\u064a\u0621 \u0628\u0627\u0644\u062c\u0646\u0648\u0646 \u0648\u0627\u0644\u0634\u062e\u0635\u064a\u0627\u062a \u0627\u0644\u0645\u062a\u0646\u0627\u0648\u0628\u0629 \u0645\u0631\u0643\u0628\u0629 \u0648\u0627\u0644\u063a\u0631\u0627\u0628\u0629 \u0648\u0627\u0644\u0648\u0642\u0648\u0639 \u0641\u064a \u0627\u0644\u0647\u0627\u0648\u064a\u0629 \u0647\u0648 \u0645\u0627\u062c\u0645\u0639 \u0628\u064a\u0646 \u0627\u0644\u0634\u062e\u0635\u064a\u0627\u062a \u0627\u0644\u062b\u0644\u0627\u062b\u0629 \u0648\u0627\u0644\u062c\u0631\u0623\u0629 \u0641\u064a \u0633\u0631\u062f \u0627\u0644\u0623\u062d\u062f\u0627\u062b \u0644\u0645 \u062a\u0643\u0646 \u063a\u0627\u0626\u0628\u0629 \u0641\u064a \u0647\u0630\u0627 \u0627\u0644\u0639\u0645\u0644 1Q84 \u0646\u0628\u062f\u0627 \u0628\u0639\u0646\u0648\u0627\u0646 \u0627\u0644\u0631\u0648\u0627\u064a\u0629 \u062d\u0631\u0641 Q \u064a\u0631\u0645\u0632 \u0627\u0644\u0649 \u0627\u0644\u0633\u0624\u0627\u0644 \u0641\u0628\u0637\u0644\u0629 \u0627\u0644\u0631\u0648\u0627\u064a\u0629 \u0627\u0648\u0645\u0627\u0645\u0629 \u0623\u0635\u0628\u062d\u062a \u0644\u0627\u062a\u062f\u0631\u0643 \u0645\u062c\u0645\u0644 \u0627\u0644\u0627\u062d\u062f\u0627\u062b \u0627\u0644\u062a\u064a \u062a\u0642\u0639 \u0645\u0646 \u062d\u0648\u0644\u0647\u0627 \u0648\u062a\u0631\u0649 \u0623\u0646\u0647\u0627 \u0623\u0635\u0628\u062d\u062a \u0641\u064a \u0639\u0627\u0644\u0645 \u0623\u062e\u0631 \u0641\u0627\u062e\u062a\u0631\u0639\u062a \u0647\u0630\u0627 \u0627\u0644\u0639\u0627\u0645. \u0627\u0648\u0645\u0627\u0645\u0629 \u0645\u062f\u0631\u0628\u0629 \u0644\u062f\u064a\u0647\u0627 \u0645\u0647\u0646\u0629 \u062e\u0637\u064a\u0631\u0629 \u0644\u0643\u0646\u0647\u0627 \u0644\u0627\u062a\u0642\u0631 \u0628\u0630\u0644\u0643 \u0644\u0623\u0646\u0647\u0627 \u062a\u0642\u0648\u0645 \u0628\u0639\u0645\u0644 \u0627\u0644\u062e\u064a\u0631 \u0639\u0644\u0649 \u062d\u062f \u0645\u0632\u0627\u0639\u0645\u0647\u0627 \u062a\u0646\u063a\u0648 \u0645\u0639\u0644\u0645 \u0627\u0644\u0631\u064a\u0627\u0636\u064a\u0627\u062a \u0627\u0644\u0630\u064a \u064a\u062a\u0648\u0647 \u0641\u064a \u0639\u0627\u0644\u0645 \u0627\u0644\u0631\u0648\u0627\u064a\u0627\u062a \u0648\u062a\u0623\u0644\u064a\u0641 \u0627\u0644\u0642\u0635\u0635 \u064a\u062c\u062f \u0646\u0641\u0633\u0647 \u0623\u0645\u0627\u0645 \u0645\u0647\u0645\u0629 \u062a\u0635\u0627\u062f\u0641\u0647\u0627 \u0627\u0644\u0645\u062e\u0627\u0637\u0631 \u0642\u062f \u062a\u0639\u0635\u0641 \u0628\u0647 \u0648\u0628\u0645\u0633\u062a\u0642\u0628\u0644\u0647 \u0648\u062a\u0624\u062f\u064a \u0628\u0647 \u0625\u0644\u0649 \u0627\u0644\u0647\u0644\u0627\u0643 \u0641\u0648\u0643\u0627 \u0622\u0631\u064a \u0627\u0644\u0641\u062a\u0627\u0629 \u0627\u0644\u0635\u0627\u0645\u062a\u0629 \u0627\u0644\u062a\u064a \u0644\u0627\u062a\u062c\u064a\u062f \u0642\u0648\u0644 \u0643\u0644\u0645\u062a\u064a\u0646 \u062a\u0646\u062c\u0632 \u0631\u0648\u0627\u064a\u0629 \u0630\u0627\u062a \u0645\u063a\u0632\u0649 \u062a\u0641\u062a\u062d \u0644\u0647\u0627 \u0628\u0648\u0627\u0628\u0629 \u062a\u0641\u0636\u064a \u0625\u0644\u0649 \u0645\u0627\u0636\u064a\u0647\u0627 \u0627\u0644\u0645\u0648\u062c\u0639 ...more<---C>Haruki Murakami</---C><+++>1Q84 BOOK 1</+++>", "Title": "1Q84 BOOK 1"},
